definition: to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment

sentences.english: Jest with an ass and he will flap you in the face with his tail.
sentences.chinese: 你跟驴子开玩笑，将被驴尾打耳光。

sentences.english: Chen Jiaying is Laojiang Hu that she would take hasty to Faye Wong in the stomach joke?
sentences.chinese: 陈家瑛是老江湖，她会草率到拿王菲的肚子开玩笑吗？

sentences.english: LL: I really was just kidding, Li Hua. You're not a big baby.
sentences.chinese: 你惹急了我就说是开玩笑。

sentences.english: We drank cheap Shancheng Beer, we joked around, we took turns singing songs.
sentences.chinese: 我们喝了廉价的山城啤酒，我们开玩笑，轮流唱歌。

sentences.english: Tom—honest injun, now—is it fun, or earnest?
sentences.chinese: 汤姆，你是开玩笑，还是说真格的？

sentences.english: His father laughs and says the boy jumped six and nine-tenths inches.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲开玩笑说小男孩跳了六寸多高。

sentences.english: The old lags used to joke on the convict boats.
sentences.chinese: 多次坐牢的惯犯过去常在囚船上开玩笑。

sentences.english: I hope you're lying for the sake of titillation .
sentences.chinese: 我希望你是随便开玩笑的意思。

sentences.english: She is always ragging Tom about his stammer.
sentences.chinese: 她总是拿汤姆的口吃开玩笑。

sentences.english: We often chaff him for his fear of his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我们常常拿他的怕老婆开玩笑。

sentences.english: AAre you kidding? Don't you see many people over there? Just on your right.
sentences.chinese: 你开玩笑吧？你没看见那里有很多人吗？就在你右边。

sentences.english: Laughing and joking are improper at a funeral.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼时大笑和开玩笑是不合适的。

sentences.english: The men started to jest about it, talk to each other, and share the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 人们开始拿这事开玩笑，互相唠着并分享自己的报纸。

sentences.english: "I know a few good-looking broads, " Johnny said jokingly .
sentences.chinese: “我认识几个漂亮女人，”约翰昵开玩笑他说。

sentences.english: Joking aside I want to reassure you that I am invited here tonight.
sentences.chinese: 抛开玩笑，我襄蜇申今晚我的确是受邀而来的。

definition: to chat and laugh/to crack jokes/to banter
to bet/to make a bet/a wager
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
